8.2.18  12:09 am   8.1.18  5:37 pm why do you have instrumental songs then?

      has anyone ever heard/created lyrics for your instrumental songs and why do you think they could hear lyrics in there that you couldn't/wouldn't/didn't?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201808011737

8.1.18  5:37 pm   I was in the studio with my band this past weekend to record the instrumentals for a few songs. I'm responsible for the vocals, and have as of now composed about 75% of the vocal melodies. But I have no idea what to do about lyrics. Long story short, I only have 2 weekends, 3 weekends max to write lyrics, finish writing vocal melodies, and record the vocal parts. I've tried in vain to get a jump start on the lyrics but I feel absolutely stuck. I don't want to vomit out nonsense filler words (this will likely be the last thing my band ever records/releases, as I am moving across the ocean next month). I just can't seem to generate anything remotely meaningful. And I want it to be. Have you struggled with writing lyrics you were happy with? Any suggestions?

     so you're saying you recorded the instrumental parts for the song before you even knew what the lyrics were? that may work for some people but that strategy makes no sense for me and i have no advice for it. i write the lyrics and music entirely together. they are inseparable and they rely entirely on each other for all their meaning

     so you're saying you recorded the instrumental parts for the song before you even knew what the lyrics were? that may work for some people but that strategy makes no sense for me and i have no advice for it. i write the lyrics and music entirely together. they are inseparable and they rely entirely on each other for all their meaning

8.1.18  7:12 pm   7.31.18  10:44 am that's good to hear, but if i have to move somewhere where i have to board a bus or an airplane to get there in a reasonable amount of time, i can't bring a 61-key keyboard with me on the bus/plane. so what do i do then?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201807311044

7.31.18  10:44 am   i want to purchase a keyboard larger than 25 keys but also i'm a new adult who has only ever moved enough stuff to fit in a few cardboard boxes. if i were to move across states (or even countries) with a multiple foot long keyboard and no driver's license (though i could probably get one if necessary), how the heck would i do that

     some of the 61 key keyboards are extremely light. the one i use is very very very light and that's actually the main reason i got it. i once carried it the entire length of central park, new york (60th ave to 110th) with the keyboard (in a case) on my right shoulder and a bag of cymbals on my left. and still felt light enough to enjoy myself

5.16.16  6:57 am   i noticed you say that you spent about 2 years writing non-stop. does this mean you don't write anymore, and are just creating the songs you wrote before? or do you still write?

     the short ones for vine were mostly written new. but anything of length was written way before. for example, crazy/raining = 2011. school = 2010. write a song on the count of 3 = 2009. in 2014 i started focusing on recording, and also really discovered video, etc. But i am planning do an album this year, so it means i will be going back into the writing archives

     the short ones for vine were mostly written new. but anything of length was written way before. for example, crazy/raining = 2011. school = 2010. write a song on the count of 3 = 2009. in 2014 i started focusing on recording, and also really discovered video, etc. But i am planning do an album this year, so it means i will be going back into the writing archives

embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201807261800

7.26.18  6:00 pm   i am having a lot of trouble learning songs by ear (on piano), particularly with the chords. you mentioned before that when you started you used a cd player to listen for individual notes. i dont have a cd player,

     no one does

     and when i slow the music down on youtube,

     this will never work with youtube, or any streaming site

     i still have a hard time hearing the individual notes when they're all played together. tips?

     you need to do it on a downloaded local version of the file. download the file and use an offline player. you can unpause and pause with lightning speed

     also i'm wondering if when going back to those first songs you learnt by ear, did you notice any mistakes in your transcription?

a big barrier for me so far has been the fear of making errors in transcription, and therefore having errors in musical knowledge. tips for that as well?

thanks.

     as long as you are not showing it to the queen just yet, you should be fine .....

html:
7.23.18  5:08 pm   7.21.18  1:14 pm is it not because it's a power of two? I mean, 2 is arguably much more "powerful" and "magic" and 1 is pretty special, in the other direction 8 is a bit less "powerful and magic" than 4, 16 is a bit less, 32, 64, etc.

on a semirelated note, what do you think of so-called 'irrational time signatures' where the 'denominator' is not a power of two?  like 7/12 (which would denote a bar of 7 eighth-note triplets, because a whole note divided into 12 equal segments is eighth-note triplets) useful notation tool or pretentious bullshit?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201807211314

7.21.18  1:14 pm   Why is 4 such a powerful magic number? 4/4 time, 4 part harmony, string quartets, 4 gospels, 4 books of islam, 4 vedas, 4 passover questions, 4 noble truths, 4 great elements, 4 noble truths, 4 seasons, 4 cardinal directions, 4 horseman, etc etc etc etc etc etc

     all nubmers are powerful and magic

html:
6.28.18  2:27 pm   6.27.18  4:49 pm What if you feel like you are missing a note though, and can't quite pick it out? Or what if you don't even know you are missing one entirely?


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201806271649

6.27.18  4:49 pm   Bill, i've been playing the piano for months, i listen to the songs i enjoy and i learn to play them by ear. I'm good at finding out the melody or the lead vocal's notes, but i'm having troubles identifying the chords and extra stuff other than the melody. what do you suggest me to do? i started to become familiar with the sounds of some of the chords i use a lot (A,Am, Em, F , Fm, Bb, C D G etc.) . Do i just listen and play more?

     a good starting trick is to pause the music and then unpause-pause very quickly. this might not work on a streaming site like youtube, but it will would very well on an offline player. when i was a kid i used to do it with a CD player. if you just listen to that micro-second of the song, you can pick out 1 note at a time. write down all the chords to a song (in time, with bar lines, etc.)..... once you do this for about 30 or 40 songs, i think you will find that you don't have to search for the individual notes anymore. ... maybe not even pause it at all. After about 100 more songs, you probably won't even have to listen to the song, you will be able to do it from memory. after about 1000 songs, you will probably be able to hear someone singing the melody for a song you have never heard before, without hearing the chords, and figure out what the chords should be. after 10,000 songs, you should be able to play along with them on the first try, never having heard the song before, and have them think you already knew the song
original_html: 6.28.18  2:27 pm   6.27.18  4:49 pm What if you feel like you are missing a note though, and can't quite pick it out? Or what if you don't even know you are missing one entirely?

answers_original.html:
6.27.18  4:49 pm   Bill, i've been playing the piano for months, i listen to the songs i enjoy and i learn to play them by ear. I'm good at finding out the melody or the lead vocal's notes, but i'm having troubles identifying the chords and extra stuff other than the melody. what do you suggest me to do? i started to become familiar with the sounds of some of the chords i use a lot (A,Am, Em, F , Fm, Bb, C D G etc.) . Do i just listen and play more?

     a good starting trick is to pause the music and then unpause-pause very quickly. this might not work on a streaming site like youtube, but it will would very well on an offline player. when i was a kid i used to do it with a CD player. if you just listen to that micro-second of the song, you can pick out 1 note at a time. write down all the chords to a song (in time, with bar lines, etc.)..... once you do this for about 30 or 40 songs, i think you will find that you don't have to search for the individual notes anymore. ... maybe not even pause it at all. After about 100 more songs, you probably won't even have to listen to the song, you will be able to do it from memory. after about 1000 songs, you will probably be able to hear someone singing the melody for a song you have never heard before, without hearing the chords, and figure out what the chords should be. after 10,000 songs, you should be able to play along with them on the first try, never having heard the song before, and have them think you already knew the song
